column5: My son asked me what I wanted to do for fathers day and I said fish of course .. we headed out to port maitland and got there around 6:30 .. got some minnows and tried for perch .. two hours fishing and only a sheephead to show for it .. decided to hit the river for some walleye .. the morning produced a lot of sheephead some big cats and one walleye for my son    Dawson practicing the trophy pose with a minnow from the bait pail    Dawsons first of the day    my biggest cat of the day  the afternoon bite heated up .. landing 5 more walleye, a few more cats and a few more  sheephead (within an hour and a half) .. even gave my son a try at driving the boat before we left .. Dawson ended up getting his personal best walleye at 5 lbs .. and outfished me yet again
great report...I have to get down to dunville one of these days.....How far up the river did you fish ? Were you up by Fishmasters ?
Now that the little guy has the trophy pose down, all he needs is the grin/shake hands/ accept the cheque pose.  Nice fish.
Nice fish! I see your son has a great baitcaster control thumb!   Isn't that what fishing is all about, goin out with your kids.
Congrats on a great day on the water and some father-son time!
Excellent report! Sounds like you taught him well! I look forward to one day fishing with a son or a nephew!
GREAT report!  Gotta love it when the little ones get into some nice fish.  Love to see the smiles.  Looks like you had a great Father's Day!
